page.title: 06RIVER AND STREAM WILDLIFE
page.content: In the streams around St Wenn you can find frogs,toads and fish.The{common {frogs}live in still water and lays its eggs near water weeds.The{toads}are common toads but we have not seen natterjack toads. The toads like to stay under stones.They fascinate us. The fishes are{trout, salmon and {stickle backs.}The rivers are not well fished and there are not many anglers. On the river banks you can sometimes find{heron, water rats and insects. {Pond skaters}and{great diving beetle are frequently seen in the summer. The rivers are fast flowing and in winter rarely freeze over.The ponds and river sides sometimes freeze. Then the creatures hibernate, notably the newts,frogs and toads.The mild winters mean many visisting birds and animals can be found near streams seeking food or water.
